item.title: Congratulating the Oregon State University Beavers baseball team for winning the 2006 National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I College World Series.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on 21st Century Competitiveness.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6589; text as passed Senate: CR S6589; text of measure as introduced in Senate: CR S6586)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6589; text as passed Senate: CR S6589; text of measure as introduced in Senate: CR S6586)

summary.text: Congratulates the Oregon State University baseball team, Head Coach Pat Casey and his coaching staff, Athletic Director Bob DeCarolis, and President Edward John Ray for an outstanding championship season.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Congratulates the Oregon State University baseball team, Head Coach Pat Casey and his coaching staff, Athletic Director Bob DeCarolis, and President Edward John Ray for an outstanding championship season.

bill.title: A resolution commending the Oregon State University baseball team for winning the 2006 College World Series.

item.title: A resolution commending the Oregon State University baseball team for winning the 2006 College World Series.
A resolution commending the Oregon State University baseball team for winning the 2006 College World Series.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6589; text as passed Senate: CR S6589; text of measure as introduced in Senate: CR S6586)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
